etymologies: late Middle English (in the sense ‘describe in a particular way’): from French qualifier, from medieval Latin qualificare, from Latin qualis ‘of what kind, of such a kind’ (see quality)

definitions: be entitled to a particular benefit or privilege by fulfilling a necessary condition

examples.text: a pensioner who does not qualify for income support

shortDefinitions: be entitled to particular benefit or privilege by fulfilling necessary condition

definitions: become eligible for a competition or its final rounds, by reaching a certain standard or defeating a competitor

examples.text: England are in danger of failing to qualify

shortDefinitions: become eligible for competition or its final rounds

definitions: be or make properly entitled to be classed in a particular way

examples.text: he qualifies as a genuine political refugee

shortDefinitions: be or make properly entitled to be classed in particular way

definitions: become officially recognized as a practitioner of a particular profession or activity, typically by undertaking a course and passing examinations

examples.text: the training necessary to qualify as a solicitor

shortDefinitions: become officially recognized as practitioner of particular profession or activity

definitions: officially recognize or establish (someone) as a practitioner of a particular profession or activity

examples.text: the courses qualify you as an instructor of the sport

shortDefinitions: officially recognize or establish someone as practitioner of particular profession or activity

definitions: make (someone) competent or knowledgeable enough to do something

examples.text: I'm not qualified to write on the subject

shortDefinitions: make someone competent or knowledgeable enough to do something

definitions: make (a statement or assertion) less absolute; add reservations to

examples.text: she felt obliged to qualify her first short answer

shortDefinitions: make statement or assertion less absolute

examples.text: his sincere piety, his large heart always qualify his errors

shortDefinitions: make something less severe or extreme

definitions: alter the strength or flavour of (something, especially a liquid)

examples.text: he qualified his mug of water with a plentiful infusion of the liquor

definitions: (of a word or phrase) attribute a quality to (another word, especially a preceding noun).
shortDefinitions: (of word or phrase) attribute quality to

definitions: attribute a specified quality to something; describe something as

examples.text: the propositions have been qualified as heretical
